thread.title: First Dates is looking for background diners – and you might get a cheap meal out of it
thread.title_full: First Dates is looking for background diners – and you might get a cheap meal out of it

author: Ben Travis
title: First Dates is looking for background diners – and you might get a cheap meal out of it
text:
Luxury Follow us: 
We use cookies to enhance your visit to our site and to bring you advertisements that might interest you. Read our Privacy and Cookie Policies to find out more. TV First Dates is looking for background diners – and you might get a cheap meal out of it 
Want to be on the telly but not ready to be the star of the show? Listen up Wednesday 22 February 2017 14:05 GMT Click to followES Entertainment Sign up: fans can join the First Dates restaurant as a background diner Channel 4 
Channel 4 ’s First Dates has become a firm favourite in recent years for its heart-warming (and occasionally heart-breaking) encounters. 
But if you’ve always wanted to get a closer look at the action without being featured fully in an episode, your time is here. 
The show is currently looking for ‘background’ diners to join the new series. 
That means those chosen will get to dine at the Paternoster Chop House by St Paul’s without having to go through the awkwardness of a filmed date. 
Even if you’re already in a relationship you can go for dinner as a couple – and you’ll get money off your bill too. First Dates couple realise they once dated 20 years ago 
“Channel 4’s First Dates is returning and looking for couples and singles to come on as background daters in the First Dates restaurant,” the advert reads. 
“You won’t be the main feature but you may appear in an episode and where the magic happens! The biggest and best TV shows of 2017 The biggest and best TV shows of 2017 1/7 The Moorside 
Sheridan Smith puts in a stellar performance as she returns to TV in the BBC's Shannon Matthews drama Stuart Wood/ITV/BBC 
Emily Watson starred in the BBC's gripping psychological thriller BBC/Kudos/Nick Briggs 
Sky Atlantic's original Nordic noir-inspired chiller is back for more bloody mysteries Sky Atlantic

Paul Abbott's comedy-drama continues to walk a tonal tightrope with total ease Channel 4/Ian Derry

“To help you with the cost of the meal, we provide each of our daters with £25.” Read more
